SSFM

Laser pulse propagation in optical fiber

This notebook shows a simple, scalar implementation of the Split-Step Fourier Methodopen in new window for solving the Nonlinear Schr√∂dinger Equationopen in new window.

‚àÇA‚àÇz=‚àíŒ±2A+iŒ≤22‚àÇ2A‚àÇt2+Œ≤36‚àÇ3A‚àÇt3‚àíiŒ≥[(|A|2A)‚àíiœâ0‚àÇ‚àÇt(|A|2A)‚àíTRA‚àÇ‚àÇt(|A|2)]

This nonlinear partial differential equation models how the envelope and phase of light pulse changes when propagating through a single mode optical fiber, when taking power attenuation (Œ±), group velocity dispersion (Œ≤2), third order dispersion (Œ≤3), waveguide nonlinearity (Œ≥) causing self-phase modulation (SPM), self-steepening (SS) and Stimulated Raman-response (SRS) (TR) into account. Note that the effects of SS and and SRS are not included (yet) in the code.

Link

https://github.com/physx-is-fun/SSFMopen in new window
